channel.title: Mega help rep++
channel.description:
I'm useing Impact V2.0 and if I make any of my monsters multi area they just don't attack you or the other player and they don't follow you. Help? I've added multi in Player.java and in Npc.java.
Here's my NPCHANDLER.java & NPC.java.
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/16875849/NPC.java
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/16875849/NPCHandler.java
THIS IS IMPACT V2 NOT PI, THE NPC AND NPCHANDLER FROM IMPACT ARE SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT TO PI.

item.title: Mega help rep++
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

So what should I do :(?

Read full topic

item.title: Mega help rep++
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:3, topic:380729”]It has a public int aggressionDistance(int i) {
switch(i) {
case 3340://mole

But that didn’t do anything.

Have a look in the files ?[/quote]
Not sure, that looks to me like the method, but i have seen some cases which npchanlder is messed up, it doesnt read changes such as hitdiff updates, etc.

Not sure, that might be your case…

Or its just a different method.

Read full topic

item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:1, topic:380729”]I’m useing Impact V2.0 and if I make any of my monsters multi area they just don’t attack you or the other player and they don’t follow you. Help?
I’ve added multi in Player.java and in Npc.java.

Here’s my NPCHANDLER.java & NPC.java.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/16875849/NPC.java

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/16875849/NPCHandler.java

THIS IS IMPACT V2 NOT PI, THE NPC AND NPCHANDLER FROM IMPACT ARE SLIGHTLY DIFFERENT TO PI.[/quote]
Does this have an “npcgetsannoyed” or similar method?

If so, you have to add the case w/ the npc id in the
“npcgetsannoyed” method.

Read full topic
